Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Complacent \Com*pla"cent\, a. [L. complacens very pleasing, p. pr. of complacere; com- + placere to please: cf. F. complaisant. See {Please} and cf. {Complaisant}.] Self-satisfied; contented; kindly; as, a complacent temper; a complacent smile. [1913 Webster]
They look up with a sort of complacent awe . . . to kings. --Burke. [1913 Webster]
complacent adj : contented to a fault; "he had become complacent after years of success"; "his self-satisfied dignity" [syn: {self-satisfied}]
